Question: Can we first prepare the ingredients for the recipe? 
 Context: Ingredients: 1 cup butterscotch chips, 1 cup butter (no substitutes), softened, 1/2 cup sugar, 1/2 cup packed brown sugar, 1 egg, 2 tablespoons milk, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 3 cups all-purpose flour, 3/4 cup shortening, 1/4 cup water, 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour, 1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 4 cups confectioners' sugar, Paste food coloring, 
Directions: 0) In a microwave, melt butterscotch chips; cool for 10 minutes. 1) In a mixing bowl, cream butter and sugars. 2) Add egg, milk and vanilla; mix well. 3) Beat in melted chips. 4) Gradually add flour; mix well. 5) Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour. 6) On a floured surface, roll out dough to 1/4-in. thickness. 7) Cut with a floured 4-1/2-in. gingerbread man cookie cutter and a 3-in. round cutter. 8) Place 2 in. apart on greased baking sheets. 9) Bake at 375 degrees F for 5-8 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. 10) Cool for 1 minute; remove to wire racks to cool completely. 11) For frosting, combine shortening, water, flour and vanilla in a mixing bowl; mix well. 12) gradually beat in sugar. 13) Place 1 cup frosting in a plastic bag; cut a small hole in corner of bag. 14) Pipe shirt and shorts on players. 15) Fill in outline and smooth with a metal spatula. 16) Tint 1/4 cup frosting black; place in a plastic bag. 17) Pipe lines on round cookies to create basketballs; pipe hair, eyes and noses on players. 18) Tint 1/4 cup frosting red; pipe a mouth on each player. 19) Tint remaining frosting to match team colors of your choice; pipe around shirts and shorts and add a letter on shirts if desired.
conv_answer: Nice, sure. There are 14 ingredients. The first 3 are 1 cup butterscotch chips, 1 cup butter (no substitutes). It should be softened. And 1/2 cup sugar.
target_answer: 1 cup butterscotch chips

Directions: 0) In a microwave, melt butterscotch chips; cool for 10 minutes. 1) In a mixing bowl, cream butter and sugars. 2) Add egg, milk and vanilla; mix well. 3) Beat in melted chips. 4) Gradually add flour; mix well. 5) Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour. 6) On a floured surface, roll out dough to 1/4-in. thickness. 7) Cut with a floured 4-1/2-in. gingerbread man cookie cutter and a 3-in. round cutter. 8) Place 2 in. apart on greased baking sheets. 9) Bake at 375 degrees F for 5-8 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. 10) Cool for 1 minute; remove to wire racks to cool completely. 11) For frosting, combine shortening, water, flour and vanilla in a mixing bowl; mix well. 12) gradually beat in sugar. 13) Place 1 cup frosting in a plastic bag; cut a small hole in corner of bag. 14) Pipe shirt and shorts on players. 15) Fill in outline and smooth with a metal spatula. 16) Tint 1/4 cup frosting black; place in a plastic bag. 17) Pipe lines on round cookies to create basketballs; pipe hair, eyes and noses on players. 18) Tint 1/4 cup frosting red; pipe a mouth on each player. 19) Tint remaining frosting to match team colors of your choice; pipe around shirts and shorts and add a letter on shirts if desired.
conv_answer: Nice. now place them 2 inch apart on greased baking sheets.

Question: What should I prepare after 1 cup butter?

Directions: 0) Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 1) In a large bowl, cream together the butter, oil, brown sugar, and white sugar until smooth. 2) Beat in the eggs and vanilla. 3) Combine the flour, baking soda, cream of tartar, and salt; stir into the creamed mixture. 4) Mix in the chocolate chips and walnuts. 5) Drop dough by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheets. 6) Bake for 12 to 15 minutes in the preheated oven, or until light brown. 7) Allow cookies to cool on the baking sheets for a couple of minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.

input:
Question: Ok. Great. What should I do? 
 Context: Ingredients: 6 cups all-purpose flour, 2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese, 3 tablespoons sugar, 2 (.25 ounce) packages active dry yeast, 2 teaspoons salt, 2 cups warm milk, 1 egg, 
Directions: 0) In a large mixing bowl, combine 3 cups flour, cheese, sugar, yeast and salt. 1) Add milk and egg; beat on low speed until smooth. 2) Stir in enough remaining flour to form a soft dough. 3) Turn onto a floured surface; knead until smooth and elastic, about 6-8 minutes. 4) Place in a greased bowl, turning once to grease top. 5) Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled, about 1 hour. 6) Punch dough down. 7) Divide in half and shape into two loaves. 8) Place in two greased 9-in pans. 9) Cover and let rise until doubled, about 45 minutes. 10) Bake at 375 degrees F for 25-30 minutes or until golden brown. 11) Remove from pans to cool on wire racks.
conv_answer: We will start by preparing the ingredients, there are 7 of them. The first two are 6 cups of all-purpose flour and 2 cups of shredded Cheddar cheese.
target_answer: 6 cups all-purpose flour

Directions: 0) In a large mixing bowl, combine 3 cups flour, cheese, sugar, yeast and salt. 1) Add milk and egg; beat on low speed until smooth. 2) Stir in enough remaining flour to form a soft dough. 3) Turn onto a floured surface; knead until smooth and elastic, about 6-8 minutes. 4) Place in a greased bowl, turning once to grease top. 5) Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled, about 1 hour. 6) Punch dough down. 7) Divide in half and shape into two loaves. 8) Place in two greased 9-in pans. 9) Cover and let rise until doubled, about 45 minutes. 10) Bake at 375 degrees F for 25-30 minutes or until golden brown. 11) Remove from pans to cool on wire racks.

 Context: Ingredients: 1/2 cup butter, softened, 1 (3 ounce) package cream cheese, 1 cup sifted all-purpose flour, 1 cup fruit preserves, 1/3 cup white sugar, 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 
Directions: 0) DAY BEFORE: Cream butter and cream cheese together until smoothly blended. 1) Beat in the flour. 2) Shape dough into a smooth ball, wrap in foil or cling wrap, and refrigerate overnight or up to a week. 3) AT BAKING TIME: Remove dough from refrigerator 30 minutes before using. 4) Start heating oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). 5) Roll chilled dough thin. 6) Cut with 3 or 4 inch round cookie cutter. 7) Place small spoonful of jam in center of each round, moisten edges with water. 8) Fold round over and press edges together. 9) Bake on ungreased cookie sheet 15 to 20 minutes. 10) Immediately roll in sugar mixed with cinnamon (traditional) OR in confectioners' sugar if preferred.

target_answer: 1/2 cup butter, softened

Question: So where should I start from? 
 Context: Ingredients: 1 (7.5 ounce) jar marinated artichoke hearts, 1 small onion, finely chopped, 1 garlic clove, minced, 4 eggs, beaten, 1/4 cup dry bread crumbs, 1/4 teaspoon ground mustard, 1/8 teaspoon dried oregano, 1/8 teaspoon pepper, 1/8 teaspoon hot pepper sauce, 2 (8 ounce) packages shredded Cheddar cheese, 2 tablespoons minced fresh parsley, 
Directions: 0) Drain artichokes, reserving half of the marinade. 1) Chop artichokes; set aside. 2) In a skillet, saute onion and garlic in reserved marinade until tender; set aside. 3) In a large bowl, combine the egg, bread crumbs, mustard, oregano, pepper and hot pepper sauce. 4) Stir in the cheese, parsley, reserved artichokes and onion mixture. 5) Fill miniature muffin cups three-fourths full. 6) Bake at 325 degrees F for 15-17 minutes or until set. 7) Cool for 5 minutes before removing from pan to wire racks. 8) Serve warm.
conv_answer: First take 1 jar marinated artichoke hearts. Drain the artichokes and keep half of the marinade aside.

Question: what is the first step to make the tarts? 
 Context: Ingredients: 1 cup white sugar, 1 cup water, 1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice, 2 tablespoons orange flower water, 2 cups all-purpose flour, 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, 1 egg, 1/2 teaspoon fresh lemon juice, 1 pinch salt, 1 tablespoon orange flower water, 4 cups raw almonds, 1 cup sugar, 3 eggs, 1/2 teaspoon baking powder, 1 teaspoon vanilla powder, 1 lemon, zested, 2 tablespoons orange flower water, cornstarch, for rolling out the dough, pine nuts, for decoration, Bring 6 cups of water to a boil., 
Directions: 0) Bring 6 cups of water to a boil. 1) Remove from heat, and add the almonds. 2) Let the almonds soak in water for about 5 minutes, then drain and peel. 3) Spread the almonds on baking sheets, and bake at 200 degrees F(95 degrees C) until completely dry and toasted. 4) This takes several hours, and needs to be prepared ahead. 5) Be careful not to burn the nuts, as this will give a bitter taste to the filling. 6) Combine 1 cup sugar and 1 cup water in a saucepan, and bring to a boil. 7) Add 1 teaspoon lemon juice, reduce heat to low, and let it simmer until syrupy, about 30 to 40 minutes. 8) Stir in orange blossom water, and remove from heat. 9) Set sugar syrup aside. 10) Combine flour and salt in a large mixing bowl. 11) Make a hole in the center, and pour oil, egg, 1/2 teaspoon lemon juice, and 1 tablespoon orange blossom water into the center. 12) Mix with fingers until the dough resembles coarse crumbs. 13) Gradually sprinkle with warm water while mixing until the dough becomes soft and pliable. 14) Divide into 4 equal portions. 15) Cover dough with a wet cloth, and set aside. 16) In a food processor, finely grind the almonds. 17) Measure 3 cups of the finely ground almonds into a mixing bowl, and stir together with 1 cup sugar, baking powder, vanilla powder, lemon zest, and 2 tablespoons orange flower water. 18) Mix in three eggs one at a time, stirring constantly; mix until you get a sticky, paste-like mixture. 19) Sprinkle cornstarch on the rolling surface to prevent sticking. 20) Roll each portion of dough very thinly, 1 to 2 millimeters (1/16 inch). 21) Cut the rolled dough into circles of about 10 centimeters (4 inches) in diameter each. 22) Lightly wipe the surface of each circle with cornstarch, and fit into a tart mold, cornstarch side down to prevent sticking. 23) Gently press the dough onto the sides and bottom of the mold, and trim extra dough from around the rim. 24) Fill three quarters of each mold with the almond filling. 25) Bake on the top shelf at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 20 to 25 minutes, or until the surface of the tart is golden and the dough is firm. 26) Remove the tarts from the molds as soon as they come out of the oven. 27) Dip each tart in the sugar syrup while still hot. 28) Stick a pine nut into the middle of each tart for decoration. 29) Place on a wire rack to drain.
conv_answer: Hi. the first step is to bring 6 cups of water to a boil.
target_answer: 0) Bring 6 cups of water to a boil.

labels: 1) Remove from heat, and add the almonds.

 Context: Ingredients: 1 cup white sugar, 1 cup water, 1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice, 2 tablespoons orange flower water, 2 cups all-purpose flour, 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, 1 egg, 1/2 teaspoon fresh lemon juice, 1 pinch salt, 1 tablespoon orange flower water, 4 cups raw almonds, 1 cup sugar, 3 eggs, 1/2 teaspoon baking powder, 1 teaspoon vanilla powder, 1 lemon, zested, 2 tablespoons orange flower water, cornstarch, for rolling out the dough, pine nuts, for decoration, Bring 6 cups of water to a boil., 
Directions: 0) Bring 6 cups of water to a boil. 1) Remove from heat, and add the almonds. 2) Let the almonds soak in water for about 5 minutes, then drain and peel. 3) Spread the almonds on baking sheets, and bake at 200 degrees F(95 degrees C) until completely dry and toasted. 4) This takes several hours, and needs to be prepared ahead. 5) Be careful not to burn the nuts, as this will give a bitter taste to the filling. 6) Combine 1 cup sugar and 1 cup water in a saucepan, and bring to a boil. 7) Add 1 teaspoon lemon juice, reduce heat to low, and let it simmer until syrupy, about 30 to 40 minutes. 8) Stir in orange blossom water, and remove from heat. 9) Set sugar syrup aside. 10) Combine flour and salt in a large mixing bowl. 11) Make a hole in the center, and pour oil, egg, 1/2 teaspoon lemon juice, and 1 tablespoon orange blossom water into the center. 12) Mix with fingers until the dough resembles coarse crumbs. 13) Gradually sprinkle with warm water while mixing until the dough becomes soft and pliable. 14) Divide into 4 equal portions. 15) Cover dough with a wet cloth, and set aside. 16) In a food processor, finely grind the almonds. 17) Measure 3 cups of the finely ground almonds into a mixing bowl, and stir together with 1 cup sugar, baking powder, vanilla powder, lemon zest, and 2 tablespoons orange flower water. 18) Mix in three eggs one at a time, stirring constantly; mix until you get a sticky, paste-like mixture. 19) Sprinkle cornstarch on the rolling surface to prevent sticking. 20) Roll each portion of dough very thinly, 1 to 2 millimeters (1/16 inch). 21) Cut the rolled dough into circles of about 10 centimeters (4 inches) in diameter each. 22) Lightly wipe the surface of each circle with cornstarch, and fit into a tart mold, cornstarch side down to prevent sticking. 23) Gently press the dough onto the sides and bottom of the mold, and trim extra dough from around the rim. 24) Fill three quarters of each mold with the almond filling. 25) Bake on the top shelf at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 20 to 25 minutes, or until the surface of the tart is golden and the dough is firm. 26) Remove the tarts from the molds as soon as they come out of the oven. 27) Dip each tart in the sugar syrup while still hot. 28) Stick a pine nut into the middle of each tart for decoration. 29) Place on a wire rack to drain.
conv_answer: You can now remove the boiling water from the heat and add 4 cups of raw almonds.
target_answer: 1) Remove from heat, and add the almonds.

predictions: 2) Let the almonds soak in water for about 5 minutes, then drain and peel.

 Context: Ingredients: 1 cup white sugar, 1 cup water, 1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice, 2 tablespoons orange flower water, 2 cups all-purpose flour, 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, 1 egg, 1/2 teaspoon fresh lemon juice, 1 pinch salt, 1 tablespoon orange flower water, 4 cups raw almonds, 1 cup sugar, 3 eggs, 1/2 teaspoon baking powder, 1 teaspoon vanilla powder, 1 lemon, zested, 2 tablespoons orange flower water, cornstarch, for rolling out the dough, pine nuts, for decoration, Bring 6 cups of water to a boil., 
Directions: 0) Bring 6 cups of water to a boil. 1) Remove from heat, and add the almonds. 2) Let the almonds soak in water for about 5 minutes, then drain and peel. 3) Spread the almonds on baking sheets, and bake at 200 degrees F(95 degrees C) until completely dry and toasted. 4) This takes several hours, and needs to be prepared ahead. 5) Be careful not to burn the nuts, as this will give a bitter taste to the filling. 6) Combine 1 cup sugar and 1 cup water in a saucepan, and bring to a boil. 7) Add 1 teaspoon lemon juice, reduce heat to low, and let it simmer until syrupy, about 30 to 40 minutes. 8) Stir in orange blossom water, and remove from heat. 9) Set sugar syrup aside. 10) Combine flour and salt in a large mixing bowl. 11) Make a hole in the center, and pour oil, egg, 1/2 teaspoon lemon juice, and 1 tablespoon orange blossom water into the center. 12) Mix with fingers until the dough resembles coarse crumbs. 13) Gradually sprinkle with warm water while mixing until the dough becomes soft and pliable. 14) Divide into 4 equal portions. 15) Cover dough with a wet cloth, and set aside. 16) In a food processor, finely grind the almonds. 17) Measure 3 cups of the finely ground almonds into a mixing bowl, and stir together with 1 cup sugar, baking powder, vanilla powder, lemon zest, and 2 tablespoons orange flower water. 18) Mix in three eggs one at a time, stirring constantly; mix until you get a sticky, paste-like mixture. 19) Sprinkle cornstarch on the rolling surface to prevent sticking. 20) Roll each portion of dough very thinly, 1 to 2 millimeters (1/16 inch). 21) Cut the rolled dough into circles of about 10 centimeters (4 inches) in diameter each. 22) Lightly wipe the surface of each circle with cornstarch, and fit into a tart mold, cornstarch side down to prevent sticking. 23) Gently press the dough onto the sides and bottom of the mold, and trim extra dough from around the rim. 24) Fill three quarters of each mold with the almond filling. 25) Bake on the top shelf at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 20 to 25 minutes, or until the surface of the tart is golden and the dough is firm. 26) Remove the tarts from the molds as soon as they come out of the oven. 27) Dip each tart in the sugar syrup while still hot. 28) Stick a pine nut into the middle of each tart for decoration. 29) Place on a wire rack to drain.
conv_answer: You can put the syrup aside and we can continue with the rest of the recipe.
target_answer: 9) Set sugar syrup aside.

predictions: 10) Combine flour and salt in a large mixing bowl.
labels: 10) Combine flour and salt in a large mixing bowl.

Question: Ok. the dough is soft now. What is next? 
 Context: Ingredients: 1 cup white sugar, 1 cup water, 1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice, 2 tablespoons orange flower water, 2 cups all-purpose flour, 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, 1 egg, 1/2 teaspoon fresh lemon juice, 1 pinch salt, 1 tablespoon orange flower water, 4 cups raw almonds, 1 cup sugar, 3 eggs, 1/2 teaspoon baking powder, 1 teaspoon vanilla powder, 1 lemon, zested, 2 tablespoons orange flower water, cornstarch, for rolling out the dough, pine nuts, for decoration, Bring 6 cups of water to a boil., 
Directions: 0) Bring 6 cups of water to a boil. 1) Remove from heat, and add the almonds. 2) Let the almonds soak in water for about 5 minutes, then drain and peel. 3) Spread the almonds on baking sheets, and bake at 200 degrees F(95 degrees C) until completely dry and toasted. 4) This takes several hours, and needs to be prepared ahead. 5) Be careful not to burn the nuts, as this will give a bitter taste to the filling. 6) Combine 1 cup sugar and 1 cup water in a saucepan, and bring to a boil. 7) Add 1 teaspoon lemon juice, reduce heat to low, and let it simmer until syrupy, about 30 to 40 minutes. 8) Stir in orange blossom water, and remove from heat. 9) Set sugar syrup aside. 10) Combine flour and salt in a large mixing bowl. 11) Make a hole in the center, and pour oil, egg, 1/2 teaspoon lemon juice, and 1 tablespoon orange blossom water into the center. 12) Mix with fingers until the dough resembles coarse crumbs. 13) Gradually sprinkle with warm water while mixing until the dough becomes soft and pliable. 14) Divide into 4 equal portions. 15) Cover dough with a wet cloth, and set aside. 16) In a food processor, finely grind the almonds. 17) Measure 3 cups of the finely ground almonds into a mixing bowl, and stir together with 1 cup sugar, baking powder, vanilla powder, lemon zest, and 2 tablespoons orange flower water. 18) Mix in three eggs one at a time, stirring constantly; mix until you get a sticky, paste-like mixture. 19) Sprinkle cornstarch on the rolling surface to prevent sticking. 20) Roll each portion of dough very thinly, 1 to 2 millimeters (1/16 inch). 21) Cut the rolled dough into circles of about 10 centimeters (4 inches) in diameter each. 22) Lightly wipe the surface of each circle with cornstarch, and fit into a tart mold, cornstarch side down to prevent sticking. 23) Gently press the dough onto the sides and bottom of the mold, and trim extra dough from around the rim. 24) Fill three quarters of each mold with the almond filling. 25) Bake on the top shelf at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 20 to 25 minutes, or until the surface of the tart is golden and the dough is firm. 26) Remove the tarts from the molds as soon as they come out of the oven. 27) Dip each tart in the sugar syrup while still hot. 28) Stick a pine nut into the middle of each tart for decoration. 29) Place on a wire rack to drain.
conv_answer: Divide the dough into 4 equal portions and cover it with a wet cloth.
target_answer: 14) Divide into 4 equal portions.

predictions: 15) Cover dough with a wet cloth, and set aside.
labels: 15) Cover dough with a wet cloth, and set aside.

mix until you get a sticky, paste-like mixture. 19) Sprinkle cornstarch on the rolling surface to prevent sticking. 20) Roll each portion of dough very thinly, 1 to 2 millimeters (1/16 inch). 21) Cut the rolled dough into circles of about 10 centimeters (4 inches) in diameter each. 22) Lightly wipe the surface of each circle with cornstarch, and fit into a tart mold, cornstarch side down to prevent sticking. 23) Gently press the dough onto the sides and bottom of the mold, and trim extra dough from around the rim. 24) Fill three quarters of each mold with the almond filling. 25) Bake on the top shelf at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 20 to 25 minutes, or until the surface of the tart is golden and the dough is firm. 26) Remove the tarts from the molds as soon as they come out of the oven. 27) Dip each tart in the sugar syrup while still hot. 28) Stick a pine nut into the middle of each tart for decoration. 29) Place on a wire rack to drain.
conv_answer: Roll out each portion of dough to a thickness of 1 to 2 millimeters. Make sure to sprinkle cornstarch on the rolling surface in order to prevent sticking.
target_answer: 19) Sprinkle cornstarch on the rolling surface to prevent sticking.

input:
Question: Are there still more steps to follow after dipping each tart in the sugar syrup? 
 Context: Ingredients: 1 cup white sugar, 1 cup water, 1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice, 2 tablespoons orange flower water, 2 cups all-purpose flour, 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, 1 egg, 1/2 teaspoon fresh lemon juice, 1 pinch salt, 1 tablespoon orange flower water, 4 cups raw almonds, 1 cup sugar, 3 eggs, 1/2 teaspoon baking powder, 1 teaspoon vanilla powder, 1 lemon, zested, 2 tablespoons orange flower water, cornstarch, for rolling out the dough, pine nuts, for decoration, Bring 6 cups of water to a boil., 
Directions: 0) Bring 6 cups of water to a boil. 1) Remove from heat, and add the almonds. 2) Let the almonds soak in water for about 5 minutes, then drain and peel. 3) Spread the almonds on baking sheets, and bake at 200 degrees F(95 degrees C) until completely dry and toasted. 4) This takes several hours, and needs to be prepared ahead. 5) Be careful not to burn the nuts, as this will give a bitter taste to the filling. 6) Combine 1 cup sugar and 1 cup water in a saucepan, and bring to a boil. 7) Add 1 teaspoon lemon juice, reduce heat to low, and let it simmer until syrupy, about 30 to 40 minutes. 8) Stir in orange blossom water, and remove from heat. 9) Set sugar syrup aside. 10) Combine flour and salt in a large mixing bowl. 11) Make a hole in the center, and pour oil, egg, 1/2 teaspoon lemon juice, and 1 tablespoon orange blossom water into the center. 12) Mix with fingers until the dough resembles coarse crumbs. 13) Gradually sprinkle with warm water while mixing until the dough becomes soft and pliable. 14) Divide into 4 equal portions. 15) Cover dough with a wet cloth, and set aside. 16) In a food processor, finely grind the almonds. 17) Measure 3 cups of the finely ground almonds into a mixing bowl, and stir together with 1 cup sugar, baking powder, vanilla powder, lemon zest, and 2 tablespoons orange flower water. 18) Mix in three eggs one at a time, stirring constantly; mix until you get a sticky, paste-like mixture. 19) Sprinkle cornstarch on the rolling surface to prevent sticking. 20) Roll each portion of dough very thinly, 1 to 2 millimeters (1/16 inch). 21) Cut the rolled dough into circles of about 10 centimeters (4 inches) in diameter each. 22) Lightly wipe the surface of each circle with cornstarch, and fit into a tart mold, cornstarch side down to prevent sticking. 23) Gently press the dough onto the sides and bottom of the mold, and trim extra dough from around the rim. 24) Fill three quarters of each mold with the almond filling. 25) Bake on the top shelf at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 20 to 25 minutes, or until the surface of the tart is golden and the dough is firm. 26) Remove the tarts from the molds as soon as they come out of the oven. 27) Dip each tart in the sugar syrup while still hot. 28) Stick a pine nut into the middle of each tart for decoration. 29) Place on a wire rack to drain.
conv_answer: Yes you can put a pine nut on each tart for decoration.
target_answer: 28) Stick a pine nut into the middle of each tart for decoration.

Directions: 0) Place whole potatoes in their skins into a large pot of boiling water; boil for 25 to 30 minutes. 1) Remove potatoes, and discard water. 2) When cool enough to handle, peel potatoes, and place on a lightly floured surface. 3) Mash potatoes with a rolling pin. 4) Place mashed potatoes into a large bowl. 5) Stir in flour, egg, parsley, salt, and nutmeg. 6) Knead well to form a smooth dough. 7) Then roll out the dough to a thickness of about 1/2 inch. 8) Cut flattened dough into thin strips, about 1 1/2 inches long. 9) Gently roll out the strips, or stretch them until the ends taper. 10) Set aside for 15 minutes. 11) In a large skillet, heat lard over medium heat. 12) Place the potato strips into the skillet, and fry until golden brown on both sides.

Directions: 0) Place whole potatoes in their skins into a large pot of boiling water; boil for 25 to 30 minutes. 1) Remove potatoes, and discard water. 2) When cool enough to handle, peel potatoes, and place on a lightly floured surface. 3) Mash potatoes with a rolling pin. 4) Place mashed potatoes into a large bowl. 5) Stir in flour, egg, parsley, salt, and nutmeg. 6) Knead well to form a smooth dough. 7) Then roll out the dough to a thickness of about 1/2 inch. 8) Cut flattened dough into thin strips, about 1 1/2 inches long. 9) Gently roll out the strips, or stretch them until the ends taper. 10) Set aside for 15 minutes. 11) In a large skillet, heat lard over medium heat. 12) Place the potato strips into the skillet, and fry until golden brown on both sides.

Question: What are the first two ingredients in a recipe? 
 Context: Ingredients: 1 1/2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast meat, 1 cup chicken broth, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper, 1 1/2 cups milk, 3 tablespoons butter, 1 onion, chopped, 1 cup chopped celery, 1/3 cup all-purpose flour, 2 cups frozen mixed vegetables, thawed, 1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley, 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme, 1 (9 inch) pastry for a 9 inch single crust pie, 1 egg, lightly beaten, 
Directions: 0) In a large saucepan over medium high heat, combine the chicken meat, chicken broth, salt and pepper. 1) Bring to a boil and reduce heat to low. 2) Cover and let simmer for 30 minutes, or until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear. 3) Remove the chicken and let cool. 4) Pour the remaining chicken broth mixture into a measuring cup. 5) Let stand; spoon off fat. 6) Add enough milk to the broth mixture to equal 2 1/2 cups. 7) Cut chicken into 1/2 inch pieces. 8) In the same pan, melt butter or margarine over medium heat. 9) Add the onion and celery. 10) Saute, stirring, for 3 minutes. 11) Stir in flour until well blended. 12) Gradually stir in broth mixture. 13) Simmer, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens and boils. 14) Add the chicken, vegetables, parsley and thyme. 15) Pour mixture into a 1 1/2 quart deep casserole dish. 16) Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). 17) Roll out pastry 1 inch larger than the diameter of the casserole dish on a lightly floured surface. 18) Cut slits in the pastry for venting air. 19) Place pastry on top of casserole. 20) Roll edges and cut away extra pastry; flute edges by pinching together. 21) Brush pastry with beaten egg and bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbling. 22) Let cool for 10 minutes and serve.
conv_answer: The first two are. One and a half pounds of skinless, boneless chicken breast meat and 1 cup of chicken broth.
target_answer: 1 1/2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast meat

Directions: 0) In a large saucepan over medium high heat, combine the chicken meat, chicken broth, salt and pepper. 1) Bring to a boil and reduce heat to low. 2) Cover and let simmer for 30 minutes, or until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear. 3) Remove the chicken and let cool. 4) Pour the remaining chicken broth mixture into a measuring cup. 5) Let stand; spoon off fat. 6) Add enough milk to the broth mixture to equal 2 1/2 cups. 7) Cut chicken into 1/2 inch pieces. 8) In the same pan, melt butter or margarine over medium heat. 9) Add the onion and celery. 10) Saute, stirring, for 3 minutes. 11) Stir in flour until well blended. 12) Gradually stir in broth mixture. 13) Simmer, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens and boils. 14) Add the chicken, vegetables, parsley and thyme. 15) Pour mixture into a 1 1/2 quart deep casserole dish. 16) Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). 17) Roll out pastry 1 inch larger than the diameter of the casserole dish on a lightly floured surface. 18) Cut slits in the pastry for venting air. 19) Place pastry on top of casserole. 20) Roll edges and cut away extra pastry; flute edges by pinching together. 21) Brush pastry with beaten egg and bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbling. 22) Let cool for 10 minutes and serve.
conv_answer: The next two ingredients are half a teaspoon of salt and one quarter teaspoon black pepper.
target_answer: 1/2 teaspoon salt

predictions: 1 cup chicken broth
labels: 1 1/2 cups milk

Directions: 0) In a large saucepan over medium high heat, combine the chicken meat, chicken broth, salt and pepper. 1) Bring to a boil and reduce heat to low. 2) Cover and let simmer for 30 minutes, or until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear. 3) Remove the chicken and let cool. 4) Pour the remaining chicken broth mixture into a measuring cup. 5) Let stand; spoon off fat. 6) Add enough milk to the broth mixture to equal 2 1/2 cups. 7) Cut chicken into 1/2 inch pieces. 8) In the same pan, melt butter or margarine over medium heat. 9) Add the onion and celery. 10) Saute, stirring, for 3 minutes. 11) Stir in flour until well blended. 12) Gradually stir in broth mixture. 13) Simmer, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens and boils. 14) Add the chicken, vegetables, parsley and thyme. 15) Pour mixture into a 1 1/2 quart deep casserole dish. 16) Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). 17) Roll out pastry 1 inch larger than the diameter of the casserole dish on a lightly floured surface. 18) Cut slits in the pastry for venting air. 19) Place pastry on top of casserole. 20) Roll edges and cut away extra pastry; flute edges by pinching together. 21) Brush pastry with beaten egg and bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbling. 22) Let cool for 10 minutes and serve.
conv_answer: In the same pan, melt butter or margarine over medium heat.
target_answer: 8) In the same pan, melt butter or margarine over medium heat.

labels: 9) Add the onion and celery.

Question: How should I start? 
 Context: Ingredients: 1 (3 1/2) pound broiler-fryer chicken, cut up, 1 pound new potatoes, cut into chunks, 2 tablespoons cooking oil, 1 cup half-and-half cream, 1 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon seasoned pepper, 3/4 cup sliced green onions, 1/4 cup chopped fresh dill weed, 1/2 cup sour cream, 
Directions: 0) In a large skillet over medium heat, brown chicken and potatoes in oil for 10-15 minutes. 1) Remove chicken and potatoes; set aside. 2) Discard all but 1 tablespoon drippings. 3) To drippings, add cream, salt and pepper; stir to mix. 4) Return chicken and potatoes to skillet. 5) Sprinkle with onions and dill. 6) Cover and simmer for 50-60 minutes or until chicken juices run clear and potatoes are tender. 7) With a slotted spoon, remove chicken and potatoes to a serving platter; keep warm. 8) Add sour cream to pan; stir to mix and heat through. 9) Serve with chicken and potatoes.
conv_answer: We can start by preparing the ingredients! The first two are one 3 and a half pounds broiler-fryer chicken, cut up and 1 pound new potatoes, cut into chunks.
target_answer: 1 (3 1/2) pound broiler-fryer chicken, cut up

 Context: Ingredients: 3/4 cup butter, 2 cups white sugar, 1 cup chopped almonds, 2 cups milk chocolate chips, 1/2 cup finely chopped almonds, 
Directions: 0) In a saucepan over low heat, combine the butter, sugar and 1 cup chopped almonds. 1) Stir constantly until mixture boils, then do not stir or shake. 2) Heat to 300 to 310 degrees F (149 to 154 degrees C), or until a small amount of syrup dropped into cold water forms hard, brittle threads. 3) Pour onto a large buttered cookie sheet. 4) Immediately press chocolate chips onto the hot candy. As the chocolate melts, spread it into a coating over the candy. 5) Sprinkle finely chopped almonds over the top; cool, and break into uneven pieces.
conv_answer: Now heat the mixture to 149 to 154 degrees Celsius.

Question: Done. What's next? 
 Context: Ingredients: 6 center cut pork chops, trimmed of any visible fat, 1 teaspoon garlic powder, 1/2 teaspoon seasoning salt, 1 egg, beaten with, 1/4 cup egg substitute, 1/4 cup all-purpose flour, 2 cups Italian-style seasoned bread crumbs, 2 tablespoons olive oil, canola cooking spray, 1 (10.75 ounce) can  reduced fat condensed cream of mushroom soup, 1/2 cup 1% low-fat milk, 1/3 cup white wine, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 1) Rinse pork chops, pat dry, and season with garlic powder and seasoning salt to taste. 2) Place the beaten egg and egg substitute mixture in a small bowl. 3) Dredge the pork chops lightly in flour, dip in the egg, and coat liberally with bread crumbs. 4) Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. 5) Place the pork chops in the pan and coat the tops with canola cooking spray. 6) Fry the pork chops 5 minutes per side, or until the breading appears well browned. 7) Transfer the chops to a 9x13 inch baking dish, and cover with foil. 8) Bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour. 9) While baking, combine the cream of mushroom soup, milk, and white wine in a medium bowl. 10) After the pork chops have baked for an hour, cover them with the soup mixture. 11) Replace foil, and bake for another 30 minutes.
conv_answer: Then prepare 6 center cut pork chops, trimmed of any visible fat. Rinse them and pat dry.
target_answer: 1) Rinse pork chops, pat dry, and season with garlic powder and seasoning salt to taste.

predictions: 2) Place the beaten egg and egg substitute mixture in a small bowl.

Directions: 0) Place water, egg, bread flour, white sugar, powdered milk, salt, 5 tablespoons butter and yeast in bread machine in the order suggested by the manufacturer. 1) Select DOUGH setting, and turn machine on. 2) Meanwhile; in a small saucepan, melt 1/3 cup butter. 3) Add 1/2 cup brown sugar and ice cream; bring to a boil, and cook for 2 minutes. 4) Pour caramel into the bottom of a lightly greased 9 x 13 inch pan. 5) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 6) When machine has finished cycling remove dough from pan and turn it out onto a lightly floured surface. 7) Pat dough into a rectangle. 8) Spread with softened butter and sprinkle lightly with cinnamon. 9) Crumble 1/2 cup brown sugar over the top. 10) Roll up, and seal edge. 11) Cut into 12 rolls, and place in prepared pan of caramel. 12) Allow to rise until doubled in size, about 45 minutes. 13) Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for approximately 20 to 25 minutes, until golden brown.

 Context: Ingredients: 1 cup warm water (110 degrees F), 1 egg, 3 cups bread flour, 1/4 cup white sugar, 3 tablespoons instant powdered milk, 1 1/2 teaspoons salt, 5 tablespoons butter, softened, 1 teaspoon instant yeast, 1/3 cup butter, 1/2 cup vanilla ice cream, 1/2 cup brown sugar, 1/2 cup butter, softened (for spreading), 1 tablespoon ground cinnamon, 1/2 cup brown sugar, 
Directions: 0) Place water, egg, bread flour, white sugar, powdered milk, salt, 5 tablespoons butter and yeast in bread machine in the order suggested by the manufacturer. 1) Select DOUGH setting, and turn machine on. 2) Meanwhile; in a small saucepan, melt 1/3 cup butter. 3) Add 1/2 cup brown sugar and ice cream; bring to a boil, and cook for 2 minutes. 4) Pour caramel into the bottom of a lightly greased 9 x 13 inch pan. 5) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 6) When machine has finished cycling remove dough from pan and turn it out onto a lightly floured surface. 7) Pat dough into a rectangle. 8) Spread with softened butter and sprinkle lightly with cinnamon. 9) Crumble 1/2 cup brown sugar over the top. 10) Roll up, and seal edge. 11) Cut into 12 rolls, and place in prepared pan of caramel. 12) Allow to rise until doubled in size, about 45 minutes. 13) Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for approximately 20 to 25 minutes, until golden brown.
conv_answer: Now pat the dough into a rectangle.
target_answer: 7) Pat dough into a rectangle.

Question: Could you tell me the details in the instruction? 
 Context: Ingredients: 1/2 cup butter, softened, 1/2 cup brown sugar, 3 bananas, mashed, 1/4 cup milk, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 2 eggs, 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup wheat bran, 1 teaspoon baking powder, 1 teaspoon baking soda, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1/2 cup chopped walnuts, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). 1) Grease a muffin pan or line with paper muffin liners. 2) In a large mixing bowl, cream butter and brown sugar together until fluffy. 3) Add bananas, milk, vanilla and eggs; mix well. 4) Stir in flour, bran, baking powder, soda and salt; blend just until moistened. 5) Stir in walnuts. 6) Pour batter into prepared muffin cups. 7) Bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 20 to 25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean. 8) Cool in the cups for 5 minutes, then remove muffins and place on a wire rack to cool completely.
conv_answer: Ok, let's first preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

input:
Question: Could I have all the ingredients to prepare two by two? 
 Context: Ingredients: 3/4 cup butter, divided, 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, divided, 4 portobello mushroom caps, sliced, 1 clove garlic, chopped, 3/4 cup all-purpose flour, divided, 1 (14.5 ounce) can beef broth, 1/2 cup dry Marsala wine, kosher salt and ground black pepper to taste, 1 tablespoon browning sauce, 6 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - pounded to 1/2 inch thickness, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 1) Melt 1/2 cup butter and heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat. 2) Cook and stir the mushroom slices in the skillet until tender. 3) Remove from heat, cover to keep warm, and set aside. 4) Melt the remaining butter and heat the remaining oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. 5) Cook and stir the garlic until tender, then gradually whisk in the flour. 6) Increase heat to high, and pour in the beef broth and Marsala wine. 7) Season with kosher salt and pepper, and whisk in the browning sauce. 8) Bring to a boil, and reduce heat to low. 9) Mix in the mushrooms, reserving remaining butter and oil in the skillet. 10) Cover saucepan, remove from heat, and set aside. 11) Season chicken with salt and pepper, and dredge in the remaining flour. 12) Cook the chicken 2 minutes per side, until browned. 13) Arrange the chicken in the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish, and cover with the sauce and mushroom mixture. 14) Cover baking dish, and bake 25 minutes in the preheated oven, or until chicken juices run clear.
conv_answer: Yes, there are 10 ingredients. The first two are 3/4 cup butter and 2 tablespoons vegetable oil. They both should be divided.
target_answer: 3/4 cup butter, divided

predictions: 4) Melt the remaining butter and heat the remaining oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat.
labels: 3/4 cup butter, divided

Question: How many ingredients are left in 1 1/4 cups all-purpose flour? 
 Context: Ingredients: 1 1/4 cups all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 cup sliced almonds, 1/4 cup butter, softened, 2/3 cup white sugar, 1 egg, beaten, 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 1) Turn a 9x5 inch loaf pan or metal bowl upside down and cover the outside with foil. 2) Place onto a cookie sheet. 3) Stir together the flour, cocoa, salt and almonds; set aside. 4) In a medium bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until smooth. 5) Beat in the egg and vanilla. 6) Gradually stir in the dry ingredients to form a fairly stiff dough. 7) On a lightly floured surface, roll the dough out to 1/4 inch in thickness. 8) Cut into circles using a glass or cookie cutter. 9) Starting at the top (bottom) of the pan or bowl, arrange cookies so they are overlapping. 10) Work toward the edges covering as much of the pan as you can. 11) Be sure to press each cookie on so you will have a good solid bowl. 12) Bake for 10 to 15 minutes in the preheated oven, until cookies are firm. 13) Cool completely. 14) Carefully turn the pan over and remove the pan from the foil, then carefully remove the foil from inside the cookie structure. 15) Fill with cookie or candy.
conv_answer: There are 5 ingredients left.
target_answer: 1 1/4 cups all-purpose flour

Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 1) Turn a 9x5 inch loaf pan or metal bowl upside down and cover the outside with foil. 2) Place onto a cookie sheet. 3) Stir together the flour, cocoa, salt and almonds; set aside. 4) In a medium bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until smooth. 5) Beat in the egg and vanilla. 6) Gradually stir in the dry ingredients to form a fairly stiff dough. 7) On a lightly floured surface, roll the dough out to 1/4 inch in thickness. 8) Cut into circles using a glass or cookie cutter. 9) Starting at the top (bottom) of the pan or bowl, arrange cookies so they are overlapping. 10) Work toward the edges covering as much of the pan as you can. 11) Be sure to press each cookie on so you will have a good solid bowl. 12) Bake for 10 to 15 minutes in the preheated oven, until cookies are firm. 13) Cool completely. 14) Carefully turn the pan over and remove the pan from the foil, then carefully remove the foil from inside the cookie structure. 15) Fill with cookie or candy.

 Context: Ingredients: 1 1/2 cups vegetable oil, 2 cups white sugar, 3 eggs, beaten, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 3 cups all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon baking soda, 1 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg, 2 1/2 cups apples - peeled, cored and diced, 1 cup chopped walnuts, 1 cup raisins (optional), 1 (16 ounce) container cream cheese frosting, 1/4 cup finely chopped walnuts, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). 1) Grease one 10 inch tube pan. 2) Beat together the oil, eggs, vanilla and sugar. 3) Sift together the flour, baking soda, salt, cinnamon and nutmeg. 4) Add to egg mixture; stir in apples, nuts and raisins. 5) Pour into prepared pan and bake at 325 degrees F (165 degrees C) for 1 1/2 hrs or until a cake tester inserted in the center comes out clean. 6) Cool and frost with cream cheese icing. 7) Sprinkle top with 1/4 cup fine chopped nuts.

Question: What's the first step to getting ready? 
 Context: Ingredients: 1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cubed, 1 cup sliced carrots, 1 cup frozen green peas, 1/2 cup sliced celery, 1/3 cup butter, 1/3 cup chopped onion, 1/3 cup all-purpose flour, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, 1/4 teaspoon celery seed, 1 3/4 cups chicken broth, 2/3 cup milk, 2 (9 inch)  unbaked pie crusts, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). 1) In a saucepan, combine chicken, carrots, peas, and celery. 2) Add water to cover and boil for 15 minutes. 3) Remove from heat, drain and set aside. 4) In the saucepan over medium heat, cook onions in butter until soft and translucent. 5) Stir in flour, salt, pepper, and celery seed. 6) Slowly stir in chicken broth and milk. 7) Simmer over medium-low heat until thick. 8) Remove from heat and set aside. 9) Place the chicken mixture in bottom pie crust. 10) Pour hot liquid mixture over. 11) Cover with top crust, seal edges, and cut away excess dough. 12) Make several small slits in the top to allow steam to escape. 13) Bake in the preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes, or until pastry is golden brown and filling is bubbly. 14) Cool for 10 minutes before serving.

 Context: Ingredients: 2 cups all-purpose flour, 1 cup white sugar, 2 teaspoons baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon baking soda, 1 1/2 teaspoons ground cinnamon, 1 teaspoon salt, 1 cup buttermilk, 1/4 cup vegetable oil, 2 eggs, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 2 tablespoons white sugar, 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 2 teaspoons margarine, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 1) Grease one 9x5 inch loaf pan. 2) Measure flour, 1 cup sugar, baking powder, baking soda, 1 1/2 teaspoons cinnamon, salt, buttermilk, oil, eggs and vanilla into large mixing bowl. 3) Beat 3 minutes. 4) Pour into prepared loaf pan. 5) Smooth top. 6) Combine 2 tablespoons white sugar, 1 teaspoon cinnamon and butter, mixing until crumbly. 7) Sprinkle topping over smoothed batter. 8) Using knife, cut in a light swirling motion to give a marbled effect. 9) Bake for about 50 minutes. 10) Test with toothpick. 11) When inserted it should come out clean. 12) Remove bread from pan to rack to cool.
conv_answer: Now grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan with some butter.
target_answer: 1) Grease one 9x5 inch loaf pan.

 Context: Ingredients: 2 cups all-purpose flour, 2 cups sugar, 1 1/2 teaspoons ground cinnamon, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1 cup water, 1/2 cup vegetable oil, 1/2 cup butter or margarine, 1/4 cup baking cocoa, 2 eggs, 1/2 cup buttermilk, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1 teaspoon baking soda, 1/2 cup butter or margarine, 1/3 cup whipping cream, 1/4 cup baking cocoa, 1 1/2 teaspoons ground cinnamon, 3 cups confectioners' sugar, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1 cup finely chopped walnuts, 
Directions: 0) In a mixing bowl, combine the first four ingredients. 1) In a saucepan, combine water, oil, butter and cocoa; bring to a boil over medium heat. 2) pour over dry ingredients; mix well. 3) Add eggs, buttermilk, vanilla and baking soda; mix well. 4) Pour into a greased and floured 15-in pan. 5) Bake at 375 degrees F for 15-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. 6) Meanwhile, for frosting, combine the butter, cream, cocoa and cinnamon in a saucepan. 7) Cook and stir over medium heat until butter is melted and mixture is heated through. 8) Remove from the heat; beat in sugar and vanilla until smooth. 9) Stir in walnuts. 10) Carefully spread over hot cake. 11) Cool completely.
conv_answer: Nice, enjoy!
target_answer: 11) Cool completely.
